title: A running list of how President Trump is changing environmental policy
description: The Trump administration has promised vast changes to U.S. science and environmental policy—and we’re tracking them here as they happen.

title: From St. Nicholas to Santa Claus: the surprising origins of Kris Kringle
description: Santa Claus, Father Christmas, St. Nick—no matter the name, everyone knows the story of this plump, jolly, bringer of gifts. Or do they?

title: Where's Santa buried? Resting places of the real St. Nick
description: The mortal remains of the 4th-century Greek bishop are likely scattered around the world as holy relics.

title: When is the first day of winter? December solstice 2018 explained.
description: Find out how astronomy and meteorology differ on the definition, why solstices happen, and how the day is marked around the world.

title: A whopping 91% of plastic isn't recycled
description: Billions of tons of plastic have been made over the past decades, and much of it is becoming trash and litter, finds the first analysis of the issue.

title: Fast facts about plastic pollution
description: Versatile, pliable, durable, cheap to produce—and ubiquitous. Plastic is all of that. It is also both a life-saving miracle product and the scourge of the Earth. Here are eight essential facts to keep in mind.

title: We visited the border wall. Here's what it looks like.
description: In 2016, our photographer visited the heavily guarded—and completely empty—parts of the 2,000-mile-long U.S.-Mexico border.

title: Both of NASA's Voyager spacecraft are now interstellar. Where to next?
description: Launched in 1977, the twin probes will likely outlive the sun. Find out what star systems they’ll meet as they head deeper into the galaxy.

description: Neo-Nazis in the Netherlands have responded violently to calls to get rid of Santa's blackface holiday assistant.

description: Santa's got some competition: a terrifying Christmas devil named Krampus, which is catching on in pop culture worldwide.

description: There's much more to America's holiday bird than white and dark meat.

description: A new spacecraft that's due to land soon on Mars will investigate why and how much the red planet rumbles.

description: The pilgrims stole from graves, the Wampanoag were devastated by disease, and the peace between them was political.

title: How World War I launched mapmaking at National Geographic
description: This Veterans Day marks the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I. It was during the war that National Geographic Society began producing original maps.

description: A pioneering lawsuit against the U.S. government has won the right to a trial, overcoming the Trump administration's efforts to cancel it in court.

description: The practice wasn’t new in 1812. But a map in a newspaper gave it a name that stuck.

description: Get the facts about springing forward and falling back, a tradition that was established in the U.S. in 1918.

description: The eerily gory waterfall is not in fact made of blood, and a new study shows just what gives it its unique color.

title: Wreckage of WWII-era warship U.S.S. Indianapolis found after 72 years
description: A search led by billionaire Paul Allen locates the cruiser at the bottom of the Philippine Sea.

description: Cecil’s killing sparked what’s been called the biggest global response to a wildlife story ever.

description: Rwandans are embracing dogs as pets in spite of the country’s dark canine history.

description: Bucking broncs, drought, and tourism are just a few challenges for the Wright family’s 150-year-old way of life.

description: When a heron inexplicably ended up in the lion enclosure, the big cat’s instincts sprung into action.

description: Lifeguards reported this year’s first cases of sea lice, which aren’t lice at all.

description: Wild armadillo meat is popular in Brazil, but a new study shows those who eat it put themselves at risk of contracting leprosy.

description: A group of grandmothers hailing from Korogocho have come together to protect and empower themselves and their community.

description: Data from a dead spacecraft suggest that this world may be the best place besides Earth for life as we know it.

description: "It's a place where Earth is so close to its limit, it's almost like another planet."

description: This unusual arrangement was likely the result of the two females coincidentally going into heat at the same time.

description: With prices for baby eels soaring to a high of nearly $3,000 a pound, illegal traders continue to chance their luck with the police.

description: Brazil and the Democratic Republic of the Congo lost the most; things improved in Indonesia. Here are five takeaways from a new report.

description: The group calling themselves 'Dare' says they are using dance as an agent of change in a nation beset by conflict.

description: After Paolo Guerrero tested positive for cocaine, scientists used Inca mummies to argue that the result may have been influenced by something else.

description: A pioneer in her field, Constance Adams’ love of the solar system and Earth fueled her life’s work.

description: A zoo celebrates as its flamingo flock gives birth to five new chicks—but the process is more difficult than it may seem.

description: A baby bird’s ability to move and its chances of survival are closely tied, a new study finds.

description: The caddisfly is one of many insects that get creative in shielding themselves from predators.

description: The Pony Express operated for less than two years, but its legend—burnished by Buffalo Bill Cody—lives on.

description: Annoyed by the persistent dripping of water in a bucket, one scientist set out to learn what creates the distinctive sound.

description: More people are turning to entomologists to identify parasites they believe are crawling on their bodies, but which turn out not to be real.

description: A short video shows young girls in India climbing into dangerous, deep wells to retrieve worm-infested water.

description: The 600-pound giant forest hog is expert at avoiding people, who are increasingly hunting the animal in its African habitat.

description: The 350-year-old genes may help researchers settle the debate about where the disease originated.

description: The toothy creature provides rare evidence of early human-caused extinctions.

description: Featured twice on the cover of National Geographic magazine, Koko led to major revelations about animal empathy and communication.

description: At Vietnam’s Can Gio reserve, monkeys performed tricks in subpar conditions. The circus has left—but the monkeys remain in possession of the corporation.

description: Rare video shows big cat tearing open its warthog victim and perusing its innards with its jawbone.

description: The American swamp sparrow’s amazing ability to pass down its song perfectly is an example of handing down a cultural tradition, scientists say.

title: After Fleeing War, Refugee Children Face Lasting Psychological Trauma
description: In Lesbos, Greece, young refugees cope with a growing mental health crisis.

title: Some Rivers Are So Drug-Polluted, Their Eels Get High on Cocaine
description: Illegal drug residues in the water could be affecting native fish.

title: These Groundbreaking Photos Show Two Worlds in One
description: Photographer David Doubilet's "over-under" images present a view of the ocean most people will never get to experience.

title: Why This Rare Lobster Is Colored Like Blue Cotton Candy
description: The critter’s pastel rainbow hues may be the result of a genetic mutation or an unusual diet.

title: Why Great White Sharks Hang Out in Warm Whirlpools
description: New research on famous white sharks Mary Lee and Lydia shows the giant fish spend a surprising amount of time in warm oceanic eddies.

title: Leopard Plays With Prey’s Own Bones
description: Rare video shows big cat tearing open its warthog victim and perusing its innards with its jawbone.

title: What Is Hogweed, the Invading Plant That Burns and Blinds?
description: The striking plant was brought to North America to decorate gardens and arboretums, but now officials are working to wipe it out.

title: Nuns Resurrect Endangered Salamanders in First-of-its-Kind Conservation Effort
description: This may be the first time a religious group has been involved in amphibian breeding program, an expert says.

title: These 38 Coral Reefs Are Thriving, Despite Threats
description: A new study found "oases" of resilient coral reefs around the world that are beating the odds against warming, pollution, and other impacts.

title: Rare Manta Ray Nursery Discovered
description: Off the coast of Texas, a coral reef houses a vibrant nursery ground where young manta rays grow up.

title: Yellowstone: A Place, A Drama
description: 'Yellowstone' presents a sweeping tableau of family, money, and tradition with some of the West’s most stunning mountains and valleys as a backdrop.

title: Long-Lost Panda Relative Revealed by 22,000-Year-Old Fossil
description: The weathered remains from a cave in China contain the world's oldest sample of panda DNA.

title: Marine Protected Areas Are Important. But Are They Working?
description: The world won't meet international ocean conservation targets by 2020, so a team of scientists is looking at what's next for saving our seas.

title: Searching for Elusive Green Sea Turtles in the Persian Gulf

title: Meet the Single Dads of the Animal World
description: These fathers fly, swim, and hop the extra mile for their babies.

title: Max Does Europe
description:
Hallå!

You've made it to one of the longest blog posts I may ever write. So long that I'd consider it more of a short novel rather than a single blog post. If you're more of a picture person head over to http://imgur.com/a/seJ1P or my Facebook page for all the images from my trip (including ones not shown here). Alternatively, find me, buy me a beer and sit back and relax while I tell you the ...

title: Rendering 12,000 Image Albums at Imgur
description:
Today marks a great day for wallpaper enthusiasts everywhere. Today's the day a newly designed Imgur launches, and with it comes some great performance improvements. My favorite is our new way to load giant albums without ridiculous lag. To put this new algorithm to the test I'm going to compare the perceived load speed of this 12,000 image album to what was previously on the site.

TL;DR


    Utilized React.js more
    Only render DOM elements that are in the ...

title: My Experience Making My First Android App
description:
Like too many people these days I tend to spend a lot of time on my phone. It's a tough habit to quit. So is playing DotA, my favorite game. Allow me to take you back over the past 3 weeks of getting to know Android development (I'll try to skip through some of the boring parts).

The Start (3 weeks ago)

With the largest e-sports tournament to date kicking off in a few weeks I saw an opportunity to corner ...

title: From 0 To 500 Users In 7 Days
description:
I recently launched an idea I had been thinking about for quite some time called Problem of the Day. If you haven't checked it out the basic run down is a new programming or logic puzzle every Monday through Friday. Most of the problems are meant to be solvable over breakfast, lunch, or whenever you have some free time.

My goal for this post is to give you some ideas on what I did for my launch so that you can see ...

title: Problem of the Day
description:
I seem to be in to launching things on my birthday. I bought the domain for this site on my birthday and I started work on a site called Problem of the Day which just officially launched today. If you're in to logic puzzles and short programming problems check it out http://www.problemotd.com/.

This site was the first time I needed to send out e-mails in mass quantities. I ended up going with Mandrill and couldn't be happier. If ...
